member.name: M:SuperMap.UI.TextStyleDialog.ShowDialog(SuperMap.Data.TextStyle,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Display text style editor and users can specify the default text style in the text style editor.
member.param: Specify the default text style.

Whether to display the specific advanced setting options ("Zoom Scale" and "Opacity" options), these advanced setting options only support label thematic map and text object. True means display and false means do not display. See: TextStyleDialog.IsThemeText property.

Whether to display the specific advanced setting options ("Angle of inclination" option), these advanced setting options only support text object in a scene. True means display and false means do not display. See: TextStyleDialog.IsThemeText property.
member.returns: Returns the TextStyle specified in the Text Style dialog. It returns the TextStyle specified in the Text Style dialog. If the user clicked OK button in the Text Style dialog. Otherwise it returns null.

member.name: M:SuperMap.UI.TextStyleDialog.ShowDialog(SuperMap.Data.GeoText,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Display text style editor and users can specify the default text style in the text style editor and the sample text in the preview region.
member.param: A GeoText object. The default text style of the text style editor can be specified by GeoText.TextStyle; the text object to operate can be specified by GeoText object, the text of the object will be used in the preview region as the sample text.

Whether to display the specific advanced setting options ("Zoom Scale" and "Opacity" options), these advanced setting options only support label thematic map and text object. True means display and false means do not display. See: TextStyleDialog.IsThemeText property.

Whether to display the specific advanced setting options ("Angle of inclination" option), these advanced setting options only support text object in a scene. True means display and false means do not display. See: TextStyleDialog.IsThemeText property.
member.returns: Return the text style set in the text style editor. If the "OK" button in the text style editor was clicked, the text style will be returned by the GeoText object, since the text content can be edited in the text style editor, the result will also be returned; if the "Cancel" button was clicked, or the text style editor was closed directly, return null.

member.name: M:SuperMap.UI.WorkspaceTree.SortNodes(SuperMap.UI.WorkspaceTreeNodeBase,SuperMap.UI.TreeNodeSortMode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts the first sub node of the specified tree nodes according to the specified parameter.
member.param: The specified tree nodes.
Selects the way of sorting, including sorting by name, sorting by type and sorting by creation time.
Specifies the order of sorting to be in order or in reverse.

member.name: M:SuperMap.UI.WorkspaceTree.SortNodes(SuperMap.UI.WorkspaceTreeNodeBase,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{SuperMap.UI.WorkspaceTreeNodeBase})
member.summary: According to the custom comparer, sorts the first-level sub nodes of the specified tree nodes.
member.param: The specified tree nodes.
The custom comparer. Users define a new way of sorting by realizing their own comparison algorithm.

member.name: M:SuperMap.UI.WorkspaceTree.Reload
member.summary: Refreshes all the tree nodes in the work space tree. After calling this method, the system will reconstruct all the tree nodes in the work space tree. Therefore, it will lead to the fact that all the tree nodes obtained before calling the Reload() method fail after calling the Reload() method.

member.summary: Finds out the tree nodes corresponding to the data set, according to the specified data set.
member.param: The specified dataset.
member.returns: Specifies the tree nodes corresponding to the data set.

member.summary: Refreshes the sub node of the tree nodes, according to the specified tree node.

member.returns: Returns a Boolean. True if successful, otherwise returns false.
